articles.author: Matt Zapotosky, John Wagner, Matt Zapotosky, John Wagner
articles.title: ‘I guess the love is gone’: Ex-FBI director Comey responds to Rudy Giuliani’s suggestion that he might have lied
articles.description: Comey, who once worked for Giuliani when he was a prosecutor, made the comment during an interview with The Washington Post.

articles.title: Giuliani: $130K was a nuisance payment - CNN Video
articles.description: Stormy Daniels' attorney Michael Avenatti reacts to Rudy Giuliani's comment on ABC News' "This Week" that the sum Avenatti's client, Stormy Daniels, received was a "nuisance payment."

articles.title: Is Giuliani still getting his facts straight? - CNN Video
articles.description: Some White House officials and a source close to President Donald Trump's legal team continue to balk at Rudy Giuliani's media blitz following his eyebrow-raising interview with Fox News host Sean Hannity.

articles.author: Erin Cunningham, Erin Cunningham
articles.title: Iran ‘prepared for all scenarios’ if Trump nixes nuclear deal, officials say
articles.description: A possible move by Washington to reimpose economic sanctions could threaten Tehran’s oil sales and commercial outreach with Europe.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/thomas-erdbrink
articles.title: Iran, Angry and Divided, Fears Deeper Crisis if Nuclear Deal Ends
articles.description: The economy was already in free fall. Now the lifeline offered by a deal that was supposed to lift barriers to the West is threatened, too.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/vivian-wang
articles.title: Schneiderman’s Resignation Leads to Turmoil and Speculation About His Successor
articles.description: Allegations that the New York attorney general abused multiple women set off a torrent of condemnations and questions about who would replace him.

articles.author: Kaitlan Collins, Kevin Liptak and Jeff Zeleny, CNN
articles.title: Trump not sold on Giuliani defense
articles.description: President Donald Trump has been flustered by the onslaught of negative coverage generated by his new personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, who has exacerbated his political troubles in recent days with a series of unscripted interviews, four sources familiar with kn…

articles.author: Alina Dizik
articles.title: A Salvation for Overloaded Parents: The Weekday Mini-Date
articles.description: A carefree hour out for an afternoon drink or snack can help relieve the stress of work and family schedules.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Look away if you don't like spiders
articles.description: This is a regal jumping spider, and there are no prizes for guessing what it's good at.

articles.title: S.E. Cupp: Sarah Sanders should know better - CNN Video
articles.description: HLN's S.E. Cupp criticizes White House press secretary Sarah Sanders for defending Gina Haspel's nomination for CIA director from a female empowerment standpoint.

articles.author: Sean Sullivan, Michael Scherer, David Weigel, Sean Sullivan, Michael Scherer, David Weigel
articles.title: GOP on edge as West Virginia considers Senate bid of controversial coal baron
articles.description: Voters in Ohio, North Carolina and Indiana also pick nominees for federal and state offices Tuesday. GOP fears a Don Blankenship win will cost them a shot at West Virginia seat.

articles.author: Katie Zezima, Scott Higham, Katie Zezima, Scott Higham
articles.title: Drug executives to testify before Congress about role in opioid crisis. One is ‘deeply sorry.’
articles.description: Five pharmaceutical distributors are accused of flooding small towns with powerful painkillers.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Nigeria shuts cough syrup manufacturers
articles.description: A BBC investigation showed employees illegally selling addictive cough syrup containing codeine.

articles.author: Eric Bradner, CNN
articles.title: Republicans to pick candidates in 3 key states in battle to control Senate
articles.description: The Republicans' bid to keep or expand their majority in the Senate starts Tuesday in West Virginia, Indiana and Ohio, with hotly contested primaries to take on three of the nation's most endangered Democratic incumbents.

articles.author: Joby Warrick, Joby Warrick
articles.title: Muzzled watchdog: How killing the nuclear deal could make it easier for Iran to pursue the bomb in secret
articles.description: U.N. inspectors gained unprecedented access to Iran’s nuclear facilities in 2015. If the nuclear deal goes away, experts fear a crucial window will be closed.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Clowns march against crime in Acapulco
articles.description: The clowns say high crime levels mean residents are afraid to organise parties and do not hire them.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/glenn-thrush, https://www.nytimes.com/by/alan-rappeport
articles.title: ‘Like a Mosquito in a Nudist Colony’: How Mick Mulvaney Found Plenty to Target at Consumer Bureau
articles.description: Boxed out of budget negotiations, Mick Mulvaney’s second job running the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau represents a second chance for him to leave his mark.

articles.author: Peter Baker and Matthew Rosenberg
articles.title: Gina Haspel Has the Experience to Run the C.I.A., and That May Be Her Biggest Problem
articles.description: As she prepares for her confirmation hearing, President Trump’s nominee to lead the spy agency faces questions about her involvement in torture and secret prisons.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Trump to reveal Iran decision
articles.description: The president is set to announce whether the US will walk away from the international nuclear deal.

articles.author: Heather Gillers
articles.title: Pension Funds Still Making Promises They Probably Can’t Keep
articles.description: Investments by public pension funds declined last quarter, widening the gap between what these funds say they will earn and what they actually earn.
